biotools.summary:
Detecting frequently interacting regions from Hi-C data.

The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.

FIREcaller: an R package for detecting frequently interacting regions from Hi-C data.

Hi-C experiments have been widely adopted to study chromatin spatial organization, which plays important roles in genome function. Frequently interacting regions (FIREs) are more informative for tissue-specific chromatin interactions than the well-established Hi-C readouts, such as A/B compartments, topologically associating domains (TADs) and chromatin loops.
